form.label: Jetty
form.title: Jetty parameters
form.description: If you are running GeoNetwork with the integrated Jetty server then you can use this panel to change some parameters, mainly the servlet name and port used to access GeoNetwork.
form.precon: Jetty must be restarted in order to make the changes effective.

form.label: DBMS
form.title: DBMS configuration
form.description: This panel allows you to change the DBMS you want to connect to. Here you can change only the configuration. You have also to create the schema and populate the database. You can do that through the 'database/setup' panel. If you select the embedded database and its data files are not there (for example because you just checked out from the subversion repository), the 'save' button will also create them and generate a new random account.
form.precon: GeoNetwork must be restarted in order to make the changes effective.

form.label: Import
form.title: Metadata import
form.description: This panel lets you reimport a previouly exported set of metadata/data. The import is not destructive, in the sense that new records will be created. So, make sure to have an empty database if you don't want metadata overlap.
form.precon: Uses MEF facilities so GeoNetwork must be running.

form.label: Export
form.title: Metadata export
form.description: This panel lets you export your metadata/data from GeoNetwork into a folder of your file system. There will be one file for each metadata/data in MEF format.
form.precon: Uses MEF facilities so GeoNetwork must be running.

form.label: Metadata Sync
form.title: Metadata synchronization
form.description: Each metadata contains links to the GeoNetwork's server in order to allow resource retrieval. If you change the server's address and port from the web interface, these links will break. This panel simply scans all metadata and fixes these links.
form.precon: All local metadata must be scanned and changed so there must not be records under editing.

form.label: 115 to 139
form.title: ISO 19115 to 19139 conversion
form.description: Prior to version 2.1, GeoNetwork managed only the old ISO 19115 metadata format (the one with short names). Starting from version 2.1 you can use the new ISO 19139 format, which is the XML encoding of the ISO 19115:2003 spec. This panel lets you convert your old metadata in ISO 19115 format to the new one.
form.precon: GeoNetwork could even be running but maybe it is better if it is stopped.

form.label: Setup
form.title: Database setup
form.description: Once you have configured your DBMS in the 'configuration/dbms' panel, you have to use this panel to create tables and fill them with initial data.
form.precon: Obviously GeoNetwork cannot be running while the database gets built.

form.label: Sample data
form.title: Sample data and metadata
form.description: There are some sample metadata that you can import into your GeoNetwork after setup. These are provided just to experiment the features and the user interface. You can even import the same metadata several times in order to fill your database for stress tests.
form.precon: Uses MEF facilities so GeoNetwork must be running.

form.label: Old installation
form.title: Migrate an old GeoNetwork
form.description: This panel allows you to migrate metadata from an old GeoNetwork 2.0.x installation. This procedure migrates the database content. After this stage, you will probably need to setup some parameters into the config.xml file (like dataDir). Other parameters (like proxy settings) must be changed using the web interface. Harvested metadata are not migrated. When migrating, both old and new nodes MUST NOT be started. If you use Tomcat and you have used only the geonetwork's 'web' folder you have to select the GeoNetwork's web app folder inside Tomcat.
form.precon: GeoNetwork must be stopped when the database is being migrated.
